name: Laguna del Magdalena
description: The Colombian Massif (Macizo Colombiano) is one of Colombia's most important ecological and hydrological regions. Located in the Andean region, it spans parts of the departments of Cauca, Huila, and Nariño. This mountainous area is known as the Water Star of Colombia (Estrella Fluvial de Colombia) because it is the birthplace of several major rivers, including the Magdalena, Cauca, Patía, and Putumayo rivers, which supply water to vast parts of the country.

name: Los Tres Chorros
description: Los Tres Chorros is a breathtaking waterfall located in the Pradera village, about 18 kilometers from the town of San Agustín, in the Huila department of Colombia. This stunning 30-meter-high waterfall is formed by the Mulales River, which originates in the Páramo de la Soledad, a high-altitude moorland rich in biodiversity

name: Purutal - Chaquira
description: The Tablón, Chaquira, La Pelota, and El Purutal route, offers a captivating journey through the heart of ancient pre-Columbian culture, showcasing remarkable archaeological sites set amidst stunning natural landscapes.

name: Cascada el Cinco
description: Cascada El Cinco is a picturesque waterfall located in the La Estrella village, approximately 5 kilometers from the main park of San Agustín, in the Huila department of Colombia.

name: El Tablon
description: El Tablón is an archaeological site near San Agustín, known for its ancient stone statues and a small ethnographic museum. It’s part of a hiking route connecting other historic sites like La Chaquira.
notes: You can explore the route on horseback or walking and visit beautifull landscapes, you need to pay to entry. Contact us for pricing details

name: Pelota - Purutal
description: La Pelota and El Purutal are archaeological sites near San Agustín, known for their colorful ancient statues and well-preserved ceremonial sculptures surrounded by lush nature.

name: Pelota - Purutal - Estrecho
description: Explore La Pelota and El Purutal with their colorful ancient statues, and discovering the powerful Estrecho del Magdalena, where Colombia’s greatest river narrows between rocky cliffs.

name: Estrecho
description: The Estrecho del Magdalena is the narrowest point of Colombia’s iconic Magdalena River, where the water rushes through a dramatic passage just 2.2 meters wide, surrounded by towering cliffs.
notes: You can explore the route on horseback or walking and visit beautifull landscapes. Contact us for pricing details

name: La parada - Santa Monica - Quebradillas
description: Discover the rich history of San Agustín with a tour of three incredible archaeological sites: La Parada, known for its zoomorphic and anthropomorphic statues; Santa Mónica, featuring ancient pottery and burial sites; and Quebradillas, home to large, intricately carved monolithic statues. A perfect blend of culture and history!
notes: You can explore the route on horseback or walking and visit beautifull landscapes. Contact us for pricing details

name: Naranjos - Alto de las chinas - Los robles
description: Explore our rich archaeological heritage visiting: Los Naranjos, known for its ancient tombs and stone carvings; Alto de las Chinas, featuring three funerary chambers and cylindrical monoliths; and Los Robles, home to large, intricately carved statues.
notes: You can explore the route on horseback or walking and visit beautifull landscapes. Contact us for pricing details

name: La Gaitana
description: Visit La Gaitana, an archaeological park near San Agustín, where you can explore ancient sculptures and ceremonial sites that reveal the rich cultural heritage of the region’s ancestral peoples. A perfect blend of history and nature!
